subject: OLD VENUS Audio
event: Any audiobook fans out there? Somehow, with Puppygate and the Cocteau and travel and cons WILD CARDS and (yes!!!) working on WINDS, I neglected to mention the OLD VENUS audiobook, which came out a few months ago. So I am mentioning it now. We have a really astonishing line-up of readers on this one. Take a look for yourself: Gardner Dozois Introduction & Author Bios SCOTT BRICK Joe Haldeman “Living Hell” W. MORGAN SHEPARD Garth Nix “By Frogsled and Lizardback…” HARRY LLOYD Michael Cassutt “The Sunset of Time” MATT FREWER Allen Steele “Frogheads” JAKE WEBER David Brin “The Tumbledowns of Cleopatra Abyss ” WIL WHEATON Matthew Hughes “Greeves and the Evening Star” STEPHEN FRY Tobias Buckell “Pale Blue Memories” PRENTICE ONAYEMI Lavie Tidhar “The Drowned Celestial” ROY DOTRICE Joe R. Lansdale “The Wizard of the Trees” MICHAEL DORN Ian McDonald “Botanica Veneris: Thirteen Papercuts..." DAME DIANA RIGG Eleanor Arnason “Ruins” MANDY WILLIAMS Paul McAuley “The Planet of Fear” TISHA DONNELLY Elizabeth Bear “The Heart’s Filthy Lesson” JANIS IAN Gwyneth Jones “A Planet Called Desire” JAKE STORMOEN Stephen Leigh “Bones of Air, Bones of Stone” GETHIN ANTHONY Mike Resnick “The Godstone of Venus” RON DONACHIE Happy listening.

comments.article: ..do you manage to do so many things in parallel ? This amount of multitasking would give me a headache. Do you devote a fixed number of hours to each activity every day or switch between various projects as and when you reach a logical conclusion on any one activity?
comments.subject: How on earth..

comments.article:
That is an amazing list of talent!

I love audiobooks, and I used to read aloud for blind students. Although there are many automated programs people can get to read for them, there is a real difference when words are spoken with meaning and expression.
I for one NEED a copy!  I'm ALL about Audiobooks! Nothing like gardening, driving, shopping, cleaning while audiobooking.
It will be worth purchasing for him and Stephen Fry alone.  I eagerly anticipate the day I can listen to Roy reading from The Winds of Winter.
comments.subject: Roy Dotrice!

comments.article:
Thanks George. I discovered audio books a couple of years ago and having a young family (boys aged 3 and 5) I had no time to read books. Now with audio books I get through 30-40 books a year. I have loved Wild Cards and have added Old Venus to my wish list.

Cheers Nadine
comments.subject: Thank you

comments.article: keep up the good work take your time Mr George you are the best. i am wondering as a author of wild card series do you play some type of poker did you ever played and did you know some old school poker pro`s  there are pretty awesome charachters in the old school vegas poker world
comments.subject: good job sir

comments.article: Curious, have you ever tried any audiobook work for a short story or anything. . .or do you just leave it to the professionals?
That's a helluva line up, Ser!  Viserys, Worf, Wesley Crusher, the Queen of Thorns, Diana Rigg herself!
comments.subject: Nice Line up!

comments.article: Ok, I'm repeating everyone else, but I have to say that that is a stellar list of both authors and readers. I'll have to add this to my listening list.

I knew about Stephen Fry reading my Wodehouse pastiche, but the rest of the line-up is superb!  Michael Dorn, Diana Rigg, Wil Wheaton, Matt Frewer (behind whom I once sat on a flight to Comox).  That's absolutely stellar.
comments.subject: Wow!

comments.article:
I always feel that the narrator of an audiobook always gets in the way of the relationship between the reader and the book. Especially in terms of ASOIAF where I want to create the voices of the characters, and their internal monologues myself, rather than hearing an interpretation of them from another person.

However, I would definitely listen to an audiobook if George did one himself, his reading of a Victarion chapter at TIFF was amazing to hear. Reminded me of the time in my childhood where I listened to Tolkien reading the rhyme that describes the Rings of Middle Earth. Magical.

I guess if someone likes to listen to an audiobook as they take a walk, or in the car, or if they're really busy that they can't find the time to properly sit down and open a physical book then it's great. The readers on Old Venus though are some of the most prolific I have ever seen for an audiobook. Might give it a purchase just so I can hear the good ol' Dame Diana Rigg read something.

So much to do and so little time to do it in... Thank you for the reminder. That is quite a line-up for the audio book.

Well continued good luck and all the best in your travels and your works!
comments.subject: A reminder

comments.article: Will Old Mars get an Audiobook treatment as well?
comments.subject: Old Mars Audiobook

comments.article: I would like that.
comments.subject: Re: Old Mars Audiobook

comments.article: You had me at Diana Rigg.
comments.subject: Diana Rigg!!

comments.article: But can you guarantee that the stories really are the 1960's version of Venus? Now that we can't judge a book by its cover things can get very challenging...
Wow, look at those voices!  I've had some credits at Audible for a couple months now - I know what to spend them on.
Listen to audiobooks all the time.  Noted!

Also, the kindle version is on sale on the Amazon U K site for 99 pence, around $1.40, just in case your wallet doesn't run to the audiobook edition. I'd describe it as the bargain of the year, were it not for 'Rogues'.

The anthology is amazing!

Wow! It's really great to see so many GAME OF THRONES actors on here. I'm definitely going to buy this. How are you enjoying season 5 George? I personally miss a lot of AFfC/ADwD material but I think it's a great adaptation and can't wait to see the rest of the season.
comments.subject: GOT

comments.article: That is a *must* buy!  Wowsers!
I wondered if you had an opinion on the NFL's ruling regarding the deflate gate issue?
comments.subject: Off topic - Triarch Belicho's patriots

comments.article:
I would love to support such a great audio collection of stories with a great collection of narrating talent.

Too bad there isn't a chance in hell that I'm paying for Audibles squashed as hell compression. The day they go lossless, I'll be their largest customer.

Let me preface this little rant by stating that I have been an audiobook fanatic for about 25 years. It's a major, major hobby of mine. I also make custom versions of several of my favorites, adding music and sound effects where there were none, depending on the audiobook in question. My custom versions of a Song of Ice and Fire kick serious ass! :)

Anyway, onto the bad...

This is another perfect example of an inferior format ruining a product. Let's look at Amazon for a sec, shall we? They want $32.95 for the squashed as hell, tinny, squiggly sounding mp3's that are unlistenable to anyone with good equipment and trained ears.

Let's take all of the wonderful performances done by the actors here, and squash the shit out of them, taking out all of the resonance, and adding that tinny and squiggly white noise to them. It's downright offensive to me.

Oh, you can throw them in to a digital editor and spend a ton of time trying to clean them up, but all you are going to get is a slightly eq'd piece of shit. You cannot polish a turd!

Once again, with data sizes the way they are now, the size of hard drives, even the cost of flash coming down as time goes on, there is SIMPLY NO EXCUSE for compressed audio. I have 0 problem if the physical product vanishes (cd's suck anyway with their easy to damage design and limited size), but if the ONLY option is to PAY for inferior audio, count me the fuck out.


Sincerely,

A very pissed Audiophile who would love this collection.
comments.subject: some good narrators there...

comments.article: Just discovered the greatness of audio books this past summer when my wife bought me a GoT and ACoK for our anniversary (since it was taking me too long to read). I listen everyday during my work commute and must say I now enjoy my drive. Need to get some more audio books as I am wrapping up the epilogue to ADWD right now =0
comments.subject: Love Audio Books

comments.article:
George,
Can you please answer how soon the audio book companies get a copy of WoW when complete? Curious if the audio book is released at same time as hard copy book?
Thanks.
comments.subject: Re: Love Audio Books

comments.article:
I love audiobooks, but only after I've read the original; for me, it's a performance. You do seem to have an impressive line-up there.

As for a writer reading his own book, Neil Gaiman is wonderful - you want to rush out and buy the book he's read at a con.

"I love audiobooks, but only after I've read the original; for me, it's a performance."

Exactly!!!!! :) My love for audios have nothing to do with reading the novel, I do that anyway :).
comments.subject: Audios

comments.article: Ron Donachie was also great performing the Fevre Dream audiobook.
comments.subject: Getting this with my next Audible credit
